title: Trump Administration Guts Education Department With More Layoffs
summary: About a fifth of the agency’s remaining staff was affected, including employees working on special education, funding for low-income students and civil rights enforcement.

title: Trump Renews Threat to Cut ‘Democrat Programs’ as Government Shutdown Enters Third Week
summary: The president said his administration was “closing up Democrat programs that we disagree with, and they’re never going to open again.” He promised to release a list of programs by Friday.

title: How the U.S. and the Arab World Teamed Up to Seal the Gaza Deal
summary: The cease-fire talks in Egypt showed that with pressure on Hamas and Israel, seemingly huge impediments could be overcome or set aside.

title: Trump Says He May Give Tomahawks to Ukraine. Is He Bluffing?
summary: President Trump’s threats to provide the missiles to Ukraine, whether he follows through on them or not, are a sign of his growing frustration with Moscow.

title: U.S. Military Kills 6 People in Boat Attack Near Venezuela, Trump Says
summary: In a social media post, the president said the people aboard a boat were suspected of smuggling drugs for an unspecified group his team had labeled terrorists.

title: Trump Awards Charlie Kirk the Presidential Medal of Freedom
summary: President Trump presented the medal to Charlie Kirk’s widow, Erika, on what would have been his 32nd birthday.

title: Jack Smith Calls Idea That Politics Infected Trump Prosecutions ‘Ludicrous’
summary: The former special counsel’s first extended remarks since resigning in January were released the same day House Republicans summoned him to testify.

title: D’Angelo, Acclaimed R&B Singer, Dies at 51 After Cancer Battle
summary: After hitting No. 1 with “Voodoo,” the genre-melding 2000 album that he promoted with a risqué music video, he vanished for more than a decade.

title: D’Angelo’s ‘Untitled’ Video Supercharged and Derailed His Career
summary: The video for “Untitled (How Does It Feel)” brought him new levels of fame, but not always the kind of attention he sought.

title: D’Angelo: 14 Essential Songs
summary: The soul singer, songwriter and producer, who died on Tuesday at 51, released three studio albums of meticulously constructed, vocally ambitious, genre-crossing music.

title: A Furious Debate Over Autism’s Causes Leaves Parents Grasping for Answers
summary: The Trump administration’s embrace of unproven or debunked theories about vaccines and Tylenol has left doctors fielding questions from worried parents.

title: Inside the New Bible-Infused Texas English Curriculum
summary: This school year, many Texas districts are teaching from an elementary curriculum that features extensive content about the Christian faith, according to a New York Times analysis.

title: The Chicago Rat Hole Was Not Made by a Rat
summary: A statistical analysis of an infamous indentation in a sidewalk suggested a 99 percent likelihood that another rodent made the mark.

title: In a New Memoir, Kevin Federline Sounds an Alarm on Britney Spears
summary: Her ex-husband says in his book that since the pop star’s conservatorship ended, “It’s become impossible to pretend everything’s OK.”

title: The Matcha Market Cracks Under Pressure
summary: Once consumed mainly in small, formal tea ceremonies, matcha is now mixed into fruity lattes and preyed on by counterfeiters. Can it survive its own popularity?

title: Mr. Trump, on the Middle East, Please Move Fast and Break Things
summary: Message to Trump: As hard as Stage 1 was for Gaza peace, you have not even seen hard yet.

title: Why Israel Won the War
summary: Israelis went to war to defeat an existential threat — and an existential lie.

title: Gaza’s Brittle Cease-Fire
summary: Plus, remembering D’Angelo. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Artists Plan Nationwide Protests Against ‘Authoritarian Forces’
summary: The visual artist Dread Scott, the playwright Lynn Nottage and others have organized a series of actions to unite the arts community against the Trump administration.

title: As Trump Hurls Fresh Threats and Insults, Hochul Has Mamdani’s Back
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic front-runner in the New York City mayor’s race, appeared with Gov. Kathy Hochul for the first time since she endorsed him last month.

title: In Patz Case, Manhattan Prosecutors Ask for Months to Decide on Retrial
summary: The district attorney is searching for witnesses and plans to ask the Supreme Court to consider the Etan Patz case. A defense lawyer for the man accused in the killing says they’re dawdling.

title: Report Finds Lead in Naked Protein Powders and Other Popular Brands
summary: Experts said the levels were not high enough to cause immediate harm, but raised the risk of long-term health effects.
